race_name: Dirty Hector - New York State Championship

top_categories.workout_context: Dirty Hector - New York State Championship rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Dirty Hector - New York State Championship isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Dirty Hector - New York State Championship when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Dirty Hector - New York State Championship’s finger lakes hills, wine country demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Dirty Hector - New York State Championship. Make this intensity feel like home.
Dirty Hector - New York State Championship’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Dirty Hector - New York State Championship’s finger lakes hills gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Dirty Hector - New York State Championship’s finger lakes hills gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Dirty Hector - New York State Championship — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Dirty Hector - New York State Championship’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Dirty Hector - New York State Championship — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on finger lakes hills gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Dirty Hector - New York State Championship — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Dirty Hector - New York State Championship’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Dirty Hector - New York State Championship requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on finger lakes hills gravel to build confidence. Expect: finger lakes hills, wine country, state championship.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Race Simulation, and Over Under to prepare you for 62 miles of finger lakes hills gravel in Trumansburg, New York.
